verbs.description: befog (third-person singular simple present befogs, present participle befogging, simple past and past participle befogged)

entries.meaning: To envelop in fog or smoke.
examples: Clouds of the most expensive incense befog the chancel  […]

entries.meaning: To confuse, mystify (a person); to make less acute or perceptive, to cloud (a person’s faculties).
examples: The voice of interested sycophancy is apt to fill their ears and to befog their judgment.

entries.meaning: To obscure, make less clear (a subject, issue, etc.).
examples: There is only one way to understand syphilis, and that is to give it impartial, discriminating discussion as an issue which concerns the general health. To color it up and hang it in a gallery of horrors, or to befog it with verbal turnings and twistings, are equally serious mistakes.
